title.narrative: F.a: Trade Union Rights, Policy and Practise: Training for Global Union Activists

description.narrative: The Engage course is part of the Global Labor University (GLU) degree program at the University of Witwatersrand, Johannesburg. The aim of the course is to provide university-level education, especially for members of the African trade union movement, and at the same time bring together trade union activists from around the world in an intensive, 8-week training program. The course provides opportunities for a new generation of trade unionists to network globally and build solidarity. The aim is to provide participants with information and increase understanding of various topics that affect the position of workers and trade unions. Topics covered include e.g. issues of the world economy, the role of the state in development, environmental issues threatenin g humanity, income distribution and wage policies, the current state and future of democratic systems, gender equality and the role of women in patriarchal societies, the future of work and changes in paid employment. Workers and the trade union movement f ace major challenges due to job restructuring, changes in the nature of work, climate change, the democratic deficit, low participation of women and youth, and growing inequality. Trade unions have not been able to respond to these changes, and in many cou ntries the trade union movement has weakened significantly. The Engage course provides an opportunity for trade union activists and decision-makers to acquire more knowledge, skills and methods to respond to changes in the operating environment. At the sam e time, they will be better able to participate in the public debate as well as in the political processes in their home countries. Participants will jointly develop strategies to defend and enforce trade union rights and decent working conditions in inter national production chains. The Engage course is a unique international training program, in which participants are selected mainly from the trade union movement in Africa, Asia, South America. The majority of participants are from Africa and a small numb er of participants from other continents. The Engage course is open to union members, activists, and representatives. The project partner is the University of Witwatersrand (Wits) in South Africa. Wits is part of the GLU network, which offers master's prog rams to trade unionists around the world. The training is provided by Wits professors and visiting lecturers from around the world.
